===Overview==
The exception display component allows you to avoid the ubiquitous "Unknown error" page. With this component you can specify various levels of exception detail from displaying a friendly error message to displaying the full stack trace and ending the http response.

===Enabling Exception Display===

Exception display with minimal detail:

*stsadm -o rapidtools-EnableExceptionDisplay -url <site url>*

http://www.ascentium.com/blog/sp/Gallery/exceptiondisplay1.png

Exception display with the stack trace included:

*stsadm -o rapidtools-EnableExceptionDisplay -url <site url> -printstack*

http://www.ascentium.com/blog/sp/Gallery/exceptiondisplay2.png

Exception display with stack trace and http response terminated. In this case no UI is rendered, only the formated exception is print to the http stream and the response is ended:

*stsadm -o rapidtools-EnableExceptionDisplay -url <site url> -endresponse*

http://www.ascentium.com/blog/sp/Gallery/exceptiondisplay3.png


===Disabling Exception Display==

*stsadm -o rapidtools-DisableExceptionDisplay -url <site url>*

===Notes===
  * You can change the error page url by specifying the -errorurl argument when enabling exception display. This makes it possible for you to create a customized error page.
  * Configuration settings for Exception display are written to the web.config file at the root of the SharePoint site instance. You can change these settings manually in the AppSettings section. All property keys are prefixed with Rapid.Tools.ExceptionDisplay
  * Because settings for Exception Display are written to the web.config file directly, you will need to run your desired stsadm command on each frontend in your SharePoint farm.
